bt.Model

Class Bittorrent

  • java.lang.Object
    • bt.Model.Bittorrent

  • public class Bittorrent
extends java.lang.Object
    Bittorrent is the main class for the client. It will initialize the Tracker data fields in its constructor for then establishing a connection with it.
    Author:
    Isaac Yochelson, Robert Schomburg and Fernando Geraci

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ClientGUI cGUI 
      private java.lang.String clientID
      Randomly generated user ID.
      private java.net.Socket clientSocket
      Client socket to communicate with the tracker server.
      private byte[][] collection
      double array pieces collection
      private boolean[] completedPieces
      This array reads true if the piece at the index has been downloaded and verified, and false otherwise.
      (package private) boolean[] connections
      There should be one entry for each successful connection mapped to peers[].
      private int countdownToRequeue
      Whenever this countdown reaches 0, which will occur every three minutes, we will add all pieces that have not been verified to our weighted request queue.

      Bytes downloaded so far.

      Will communicate with the tracker every N seconds.

      Bytes uploaded so far.
      private byte[][] verificationArray
      This array stores the correct SHA-1 hashes for each piece of the file this object was instantiated to retrieve.

      Priority queue of requests to be made
      private java.io.DataOutputStream writeToServer
      Output stream to server.

      • printPeerList

        public void printPeerList()

      • connectToPeer

        public void connectToPeer(int peer)
                   throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                          java.io.IOException,
                          DuplicatePeerException
        Connect to the selected peer. Rustic implementation, but it's just a starter.
        Parameters:
        peer - peer number
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if we cannot open the torrent file for reading
        java.net.UnknownHostException - thrown if we cannot resolve the tracker's hostname
        DuplicatePeerException - thrown if the peer is already in the peer list

      • connectToIncomingPeer

        public void connectToIncomingPeer(java.lang.String IPAddress,
                         int port,
                         java.net.Socket socket)
                           throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        Creates a new peer connection to an incoming peer from the server.
        Parameters:
        String - IPAddress
        int - port
        Socket - socket
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if we cannot open the torrent file for reading
        java.net.UnknownHostException - thrown if we cannot resolve the tracker's hostname

      • connectToPeer

        public void connectToPeer(java.lang.String peer)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          java.net.UnknownHostException,
                          java.io.IOException,
                          DuplicatePeerException
        For the sake of Project 0, this will connect to the selected peer. Please do not pay attention to the i+1, that's to compensate an i - 1 on the called method.
        Parameters:
        peer - ipAndPort
        Throws:
        DuplicatePeerException
        java.io.IOException
        java.net.UnknownHostException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • disposePeers

        public void disposePeers()
        It will terminate all the connection with the peers.

      • populateWeightedRequestQueue

        private void populateWeightedRequestQueue()
        It creates a queue for delivery pieces as per their priority.

      • simpleDownloadAlgorithm

        public void simpleDownloadAlgorithm()
        This method is a simple algorithm for sending requests for a file.

      • downloadAlgorithm

        public void downloadAlgorithm()
        For each peer ask 3 pieces and re-queue every N milliseconds. Each peer is responsible for keeping state on number of served and pending requests.

      • updateWeights

        private void updateWeights()
        Updates the requests' weights in the queue.
